intro: Oreocnide pedunculata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow to orange. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds. Oreocnide pedunculata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mountainous areas.
